column4: So, I have an IDE with ubuntu loaded on it, and a SATA with Windows. I got Ubuntu to mount the Windows drive, and i added it as (hd1,0) in my menu.lst, but I can't get GRUB to load it correctly. Not to mention, I can't get GRUB to interact graphically after loading gfxboot. The hell?
where is grub installed?
/boot
i suppose....but i dunno how the sata works...
The IDE is the master, and it is installed on the IDE
ok so it's really strange
the boot sequence in bios is correct?
Yes, the sequence in the bios is correct. Get this, when I start the comp up, instead of running straight to the Grub boot menu, I have to press Esc to view the non graphical menu.
ok, now i got it!
so with an text editor open the /boot/grub/menu.list
HEre: http://pastebin.com/m70d9305a
perfect on line 25 there is hiddenmenu..comment it and save the file :)
like this: "# hiddenmenu"?
yes. it should appear now
Why won't the SATA (Windows) drive loead?
you should add it in the menu, but i have no experience with sata at boot...
Look at like 118 http://pastebin.com/m70d9305a
is saw..it's correct but i don't know if hd is ok also for sata...
I did cat /boot/grub/device.map in terminal, and got this:
so is correct
did you solved?
